metadata.title: CVE-2016-3076 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the j2k_encode_entry function in Pillow 2.5.0through 3.1.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memorycorruption) via a crafted Jpeg2000 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1').
